title: The 90-Minute Lifestyle Reset Solo Creators Can Actually Stick To

fact_report.claim: Adults should target 7–9 hours of sleep to maintain circadian stability before attempting performance resets.

sources.name: American Academy of Sleep Medicine & Sleep Research Society Joint Consensus
sources.quote: Adults should sleep 7 or more hours per night on a regular basis to promote optimal health.

fact_report.claim: 150 minutes of moderate-intensity activity per week satisfies ACSM cardio guidelines.

sources.name: American College of Sports Medicine Guidelines for Exercise Testing and Prescription (11th ed.)
sources.quote: Adults should accrue at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity per week.

fact_report.claim: USDA recommends ~25 g of fiber per day for women and 38 g for men.

sources.name: USDA Dietary Guidelines for Americans 2020–2025
sources.quote: Adequate Intake for fiber: 25 g/day for adult women and 38 g/day for adult men.

fact_report.notes: Meal plan pointing to 20–25% of intake is factually grounded.

fact_report.claim: 10,000-lux light boxes positioned 16–24 inches from the face simulate outdoor daylight exposure in winter latitudes above 40°.

sources.name: Mayo Clinic Seasonal Affective Disorder Light Therapy Guidance
sources.quote: A 10,000-lux light box placed 16 to 24 inches from your face is effective for most people when used in the morning.

research_log.quote: Adults should sleep 7 or more hours per night on a regular basis to promote optimal health.
Adults should accrue at least 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic activity per week.
Adequate Intake for fiber: 25 g/day for adult women and 38 g/day for adult men.
A 10,000-lux light box placed 16 to 24 inches from your face is effective for most people when used in the morning.
